Question: Consider the following logical statement: ~(P ∧ Q) → (R ∨ S).
Show, using logical equivalences, that this statement is logically equivalent to (P ∧ Q) ∨ (R ∨ S).
You may use the following logical equivalences: Material Implication: P → Q ≡ ~P ∨ Q; De Morgan's Laws: ~(P ∧ Q) ≡ ~P ∨ ~Q and ~(P ∨ Q) ≡ ~P ∧ ~Q; Double Negation: ~(~P) ≡ P.
